intro: Hovea heterophylla f. typica, commonly known as the typical hovea, is a flowering plant species native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology. The plant exhibits variable leaf shapes, with some leaves being trifoliate and others simple, depending on environmental conditions. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
